subject: Law
title: The English Bill of Rights (1689)
description: A quick, practical guide to The English Bill of Rights (1689).

hook.text: England's Glorious Revolution ended with Parliament telling the new king: accept these rights or don't be king.

buildup.text: The English Bill of Rights (1689) limited royal power and guaranteed parliamentary supremacy and individual liberties.

discovery.text: It banned cruel punishment, guaranteed free speech in Parliament, and required regular elections.

twist.text: These rights applied only to Protestants and property-owning men. Universal application took centuries more.

climax.text: The American Founders drew heavily on it. The US Bill of Rights echoes many of its protections.

punchline.text: Parliament over king. Rights over power. 1689 set the template.

quiz.question: What did the English Bill of Rights establish?
